column10: Release of MCP-1 and IL-8 from lung epithelial cells exposed to volatile organic compounds.
column11: Increased indoor air concentrations of volatile organic compounds (VOC) have been shown to contribute to the risk of respiratory and allergic diseases. The aim of this study was to investigate the inflammatory potential of single VOC and mixtures using an in vitro model. TNF-alpha stimulated human lung epithelial cells (A549) were exposed to VOC (1 ng/m3-100g/m3) via gas phase. After 20 h of exposure cytotoxicity and the release of the pro-inflammatory molecules monocyte chemoattractant protein-1 (MCP-1), I
